description: Two parts: Psychrometry calculations for ceramic drying processes (10%) and sintering problems related to ceramic firing (10%). Includes mass/energy balances and numerical problems.

Individual reports on two lab classes: Lab 1 (ceramic raw materials/forming processes) and Lab 2 (firing equipment/postfiring glazing). Includes short answers and reflections (4-page limit per report).
2-hour invigilated written exam covering Weeks 1-5 content (ceramic processing, ternary phase equilibria) with short-answer questions and calculations.
2-hour formal exam covering Weeks 7-12 content (ceramic drying/firing, ternary phase equilibria) with short-answer questions and calculations. Hurdle requirement: minimum 35% score.
